block.p: Catherine Joanna Rodamer, a daughter of Mary and Robert Rodamer of Pawleys Island, S.C., was married last evening to Adam J. Green, a son of Joanna Green and Peter J. Green, both of New York. James A. Cone, a friend of the couple, performed the ceremony at their home in Yountville, Calif.

Mrs. Green, 29, teaches second grade at Patterson Elementary School in Vallejo, Calif. She graduated from Albion College and received a master's degree in education from the University of California at Berkeley. Her father retired as the president of the Unistrut Corporation, a manufacturer of metal shelving in Cleveland.

Catherine Joanna Rodamer, a daughter of Mary and Robert Rodamer of Pawleys Island, S.C., was married last evening to Adam J. Green, a son of Joanna Green and Peter J. Green, both of New York. James A. Cone, a friend of the couple, performed the ceremony at their home in Yountville, Calif.

Mrs. Green, 29, teaches second grade at Patterson Elementary School in Vallejo, Calif. She graduated from Albion College and received a master's degree in education from the University of California at Berkeley. Her father retired as the president of the Unistrut Corporation, a manufacturer of metal shelving in Cleveland.

Mr. Green, 33, is the president of A&J's Amazin, a company in Napa, Calif., that makes decorative gift bottles. He graduated from Syracuse University. His father retired as the president of Cotton City Industries, a manufacturer of women's apparel in New York. The bridegroom's mother was a founder of the Silver Palate gourmet food store in New York.
